definition: to match or surpass, typically by imitation
sentence: He tried to emulate his father's success in the business world.

definition: like a labyrinth; irregular and twisting
sentence: The labyrinthine streets of the old city were easy to get lost in.

definition: a spoken or written account of connected events; a story
sentence: The narrative of the novel captivated readers from the start.
She handled the situation with great finesse.

definition: a manuscript or piece of writing material on which the original writing has been effaced to make room for later writing
sentence: The ancient palimpsest revealed layers of history.
The transitory nature of life makes every moment precious.

definition: having or showing an excessive or submissive fondness for one's wife
sentence: He was known for his uxorious behavior, always catering to her whims.

definition: having a very eager approach to an activity
sentence: She was a voracious reader, devouring books of all genres.

definition: attractive or appealing in a fresh, innocent way
sentence: The child's winsome smile melted everyone's hearts.

definition: constantly changing pattern of shapes and colors.
sentence: The artist's work was a kaleidoscopic explosion of color that captivated viewers.
